intro: Phaeostemma fucata, commonly known as the blackroot or blackstem, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive dark purple to black roots. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Phaeostemma fucata is typically found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
